title: Advanced Conditional Structures
description: Mastering complex conditional forms and mixed conditionals

sections.title: Mixed Conditionals
sections.explanation: Mixed conditionals combine different time frames in the if-clause and main clause to express complex hypothetical situations.

patterns.name: Past condition, present result
patterns.example: If I had studied medicine, I would be a doctor now.
patterns.explanation: Past hypothetical action affecting present situation

patterns.name: Present condition, past result
patterns.structure: If + simple past, would have + past participle
patterns.example: If she weren't so cautious, she would have invested in Bitcoin.
patterns.explanation: Present general condition affecting past situation

sections.title: Inverted Conditionals
sections.explanation: Formal conditional structures without 'if' using subject-auxiliary inversion.

patterns.name: Had inversion (third conditional)
patterns.standard: If I had known about the meeting, I would have attended.
patterns.inverted: Had I known about the meeting, I would have attended.

patterns.name: Were inversion (second conditional)
patterns.standard: If I were you, I would reconsider.
patterns.inverted: Were I you, I would reconsider.

patterns.name: Should inversion (first conditional)
patterns.standard: If you should need any help, please call.
patterns.inverted: Should you need any help, please call.

sections.title: Alternative Conditional Expressions
sections.explanation: Various expressions that function similarly to if-clauses.

expressions.example: The project will proceed provided that funding is secured.
I'll lend you the money on condition that you repay it by Friday.
Suppose the deal falls through, what's our backup plan?
But for your help, we would have failed.
Start now; otherwise, you won't finish on time.

sections.title: Conditional Wishes and Regrets
sections.explanation: Using wish, if only, and would rather to express hypothetical preferences.

patterns.example: I wish I had more time for hobbies.
I wish I had taken that job offer.
If only we had listened to the warnings.
I'd rather you didn't mention this to anyone.

exercises.original: If the board had approved the budget, we would have expanded.
exercises.answer: Had the board approved the budget, we would have expanded.

exercises.situation: She didn't study finance (past), so she doesn't understand the report (present).
exercises.answer: If she had studied finance, she would understand the report now.

exercises.sentence: _____ the government intervention, the bank would have collapsed.
